title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9 ยง 5.28 - Executive Order No. 28: Continuation of Prior Executive Orders Naming State Office Buildings. [*]
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9 ยง 5.28 - Executive Order No. 28: Continuation of Prior Executive Orders Naming State Office Buildings. [*]
State Regulations
WHEREAS, Executive Order No. 3, issued January 5, 1995, directed a comprehensive review of all executive orders and amendments thereto
in effect as of that date; and
WHEREAS, during the course of that review it has been
determined that certain executive orders named certain state office buildings
in honor of prominent New Yorkers; NOW, THEREFORE, I, GEORGE E. PATAKI, Governor of the State
of New York, by virtue of the authority vested in me by the Constitution and

Laws of the State of New York, do hereby order that the executive orders listed
below are continued by this Executive Order. Executive Order No. 46, issued August 28, 1984 (renaming the State Office Building Campus in Albany the Governor W. Averell Harriman State Office Building Campus); Executive Order No. 100, issued August 31, 1987 (naming the Watertown State Office Building the Dulles State Office

Building); Executive Order No. 114, issued December
9, 1988 (naming the Poughkeepsie State Office Building the Eleanor Roosevelt

State Office Building); and

Executive Order No. 158, issued June 23, 1992 (naming the New Scotland Avenue Laboratory Building the David Axelrod

Institute for Public Health). Signed: George E. Pataki

Dated: April 9, 1996

Footnotes
*
[Revoked by Executive Order

No. 5 (Eliot Spitzer), infra. ] [Revoked by Executive Order No. 9 (David A. Paterson), infra. ] [Revoked by Executive Order No. 2 (Andrew M. Cuomo), infra. ]
Notes

5.28

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
